subtitle: An updated version of sausage rolls: crisp pastry parcels are filled with pork and herbs.

method.text: Cook the minced pork in a non-stick frying pan, without adding any fat, for 3-4 min or until lightly browned. Remove from the pan and drain off any juice.
Melt 15 g of the butter in the pan. Add the salad onion and cook for 2 min. Stir in the breadcrumbs and cook for 2-3 min. Mix with the pork, sage and seasoning. Leave to cool.

Melt the remaining butter. Use to brush 3 of the pastry sheets, placing on top of each other. Cut lengthwise into 3, then cut each strip into 4 to make 12 squares. Repeat with remaining 3 sheets of filo pastry.
Divide the filling between the squares and roll up. Press the ends of filo pastry together to make 'cracker ends'. Brush with remaining butter and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Place on a lightly oiled baking tray. Cook in the oven for 6-8 min or until golden brown and crisp. Serve hot or cold.

title: Christmas crackers
